roleset.name: fight or scare off
roleset.note: REPEL-V NOTES: Frames file for 'repel' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Verbnet entry 31.1, other framed members include comfort, convince, encourage, interest, reassure, scare, shock, spook, threaten, worry. I'm not sure about that. (from repel.01-v predicate notes)

example.name: repel-v: agentive
example.text: [Sea Containers Ltd.]-1, in a long-awaited move *trace*-1 to repel a hostile takeover bid, said it will sell $1.1 billion of assets and use some of the proceeds to buy about 50% of its common shares for $70 apiece.

example.name: ARG1 and ARG2
example.text: For a long time , the Taiwanese people have been deeply repelled by moneyed politics and the interference of organized crime .
example.arg: by moneyed politics and the interference of organized crime

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1
example.text: All the people of Somalia are urged to repel this invasion .
